approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._depositFee: The current deposit fee as obtained by depositFee().
params._netShares: The amount of this gToken shares to receive.
params._totalReserve: The reserve balance as obtained by totalReserve().
params._totalSupply: The shares supply as obtained by totalSupply().

returns._cost: The cost, in the reserve token, to be paid.
returns._feeShares: The fee amount of shares being deducted.

params._cost: The amount of reserve token being deposited.
params._depositFee: The current deposit fee as obtained by depositFee().
params._totalReserve: The reserve balance as obtained by totalReserve().
params._totalSupply: The shares supply as obtained by totalSupply().

returns._feeShares: The fee amount of shares being deducted.
returns._netShares: The net amount of shares being received.

params._grossShares: The amount of this gToken shares to provide.
params._totalReserve: The reserve balance as obtained by totalReserve().
params._totalSupply: The shares supply as obtained by totalSupply().
params._withdrawalFee: The current withdrawal fee as obtained by withdrawalFee().

returns._cost: The cost, in the reserve token, to be received.
returns._feeShares: The fee amount of shares being deducted.

params._cost: The amount of reserve token being withdrawn.
params._totalReserve: The reserve balance as obtained by totalReserve()
params._totalSupply: The shares supply as obtained by totalSupply()
params._withdrawalFee: The current withdrawal fee as obtained by withdrawalFee()

returns._feeShares: The fee amount of shares being deducted.
returns._grossShares: The total amount of shares being deducted,                     including fees.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

params._cost: The amount of reserve token being deposited in the             operation.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

params._candidate: The candidate for which we want to know the number                  of delegated votes.

returns._votes: The candidate number of votes. It is the sum of the               balances of the voters that have him as cadidate at               the end of the previous voting interval.

params._grossShares: The gross amount of this gToken shares being                    redeemed in the operation.

calcDepositCostFromShares(uint256,uint25.notice: Allows for the beforehand calculation of the amount of        reserve token to be deposited in order to receive the desired        amount of shares.

calcDepositSharesFromCost(uint256,uint25.notice: Allows for the beforehand calculation of shares to be        received/minted upon depositing to the contract.

calcWithdrawalCostFromShares(uint256,uin.notice: Allows for the beforehand calculation of the amount of        reserve token to be withdrawn given the desired amount of        shares.

calcWithdrawalSharesFromCost(uint256,uin.notice: Allows for the beforehand calculation of shares to be        given/burned upon withdrawing from the contract.

deposit(uint256).notice: Performs the minting of gToken shares upon the deposit of the        reserve token. The actual number of shares being minted can        be calculated using the calcDepositSharesFromCost function.        In every deposit, 10% of the shares is retained in terms of        deposit fee. The fee amount and half of its equivalent        reserve amount are immediately burned. The funds will be        pulled in by this contract, therefore they must be previously        approved.

depositFee().notice: Provides the current minting/deposit fee. This fee is        applied to the amount of this gToken shares being created        upon deposit. The fee defaults to 10%.

setCandidate(address).notice: Changes the voter's choice for candidate and vote delegation.        It is only going to be reflected in the voting by the next        interval. The interval is 24 hours and resets at 12AM UTC.        This function will emit a ChangeCandidate event.

totalReserve().notice: Provides the amount of reserve tokens currently being help by        this contract.

votes(address).notice: Provides the number of votes a given candidate has at the end        of the previous voting interval. The interval is 24 hours        and resets at 12AM UTC. See _transferVotes().

withdraw(uint256).notice: Performs the burning of gToken shares upon the withdrawal of        the reserve token. The actual amount of the reserve token to        be received can be calculated using the        calcWithdrawalCostFromShares function. In every withdrawal,        10% of the shares is retained in terms of withdrawal fee.        The fee amount and half of its equivalent reserve amount are        immediately burned.

withdrawalFee().notice: Provides the current burning/withdrawal fee. This fee is        applied to the amount of this gToken shares being redeemed        upon withdrawal. The fee defaults to 10%.
